topic.title: Virus block list
topic.body:
Idea is to scan all hosted files with multiple anti mallware tools and put the ones found in a block list.
I wish I could scan images for child abuse but only good service I found is PhotoDNA from Microsoft and you need to be an organisation to apply.

Is it correct that I can only make a blocklist for users or zites? So no individual files? I will have to block depending on the zite being public/private then.

This is a side project while I'm learning Python so might take a while to implement.
You can post related projects/tips here.

1616231596_1CQzPmMXnfH3eJvpKGNfsVnUXxiHZ.body: It's fun to try out and get to know how it works. I'll be here more in the future!

1617430409_15FbScWG2wGbwWdjTCfaq8rHHutm4.body:
I see a lot of people making the world into a better place.
But yes, some day we will go to hell when earth is being consumed by a dying sun.

1618604090_19xhtyj7LfruJTijwdhgR7yocsLVr.body: hi jo23. Your research sounds interesting. I'll give it a read

1618347400_1HV7aMJLo3XMuij1h17kP12ZYvp1Y.body:
I run a virtual machine that's on 24/7 and browse Zer0net from there to discover new zites to feed.
I would like an easier way to download an entire Zite as I only found a setting to auto download new posts and not the older ones.
Edit: I now understand I have to do my own moderation and not auto download everything and there are options to follow the people I trust so don't need a new setting in Zer0net

1618008531_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
I am using the Fairphone and I love it! Easy to repair, long life and gives you a lot of options for what OS you want to run.
I am slowly going from 'Google Android' to 'LineageOS Android' (with some Google apps) to hopefully Ubuntu Touch soon when I found alternatives for some convenient everyday apps.

Edit: SD card storage on a Fairphone is reported to work up to 400GB. I assume you can get 1TB to work these days

1630703227_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
I'm here because there seem to be great people in this network and the technology is cool.
I follow the conversations about what the next step for ZeroNet should be but it does not look like someone here can decide on that. I might check out a fork as well.

1630944991_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8B.body:
How can we find the most up to date fork? There are a lot on github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/network/members
One that seems to be interesting is github.com/zeronet-enhanced but the last update on that is end of 2020

> [leonarddurden](#comment_45_15UYgac5oQizmt3ZDVUEPjuo97WHYqswSD): I believe more of us could download the source code right now ( https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/ ) and be part of the resistance [...]
I actually want to learn Python now and contribute. I got to finish my JAVA classes first though and do this as a side project

1631606942_1CL3T1Xn3FtyyfhFhfjCiEiaVzhmQ.body: heckin' typo going to make people mad :D

> [anonymoose](#comment_44_12Y8rPJTMwJ3tTh5j81JPy6HrMf4KvY6Uq): Yes, maybe it can be of interest to you [...]

Great list! Thank you

1632037357_1BxrMQR2odvohNyH3mgZo1z9fkj4q.body:
yes, I probably need to upgrade to v3 soon. 
Will do when I have time
